item.title: HotSpot JVM: Thread-Local Allocation Buffers
item.description: Introduction Applications developed in managed languages running on top of a virtual-machine like the JVM or the CLR tend to create inordinate amounts of objects, as developers are freed from having to manually take care of managing the created object’s life-cycles. If not for the occasional object allocation optimized away by a smart compiler, most object creation involves the allocation of memory in the application’s heap. Given that nowadays most applications are multi-threaded, allocating an object on the heap can be troublesome – multiple threads may attempt to do it concurrently and unless some sort of synchronization logic is involved, malign data-races are bound to happen.

item.title: Setting up the JVM HotSpot in CLion
item.description: Introduction As I’ve already found myself more than once going through the steps of building the JDK on my Ubuntu machine and getting the Hotspot’s source loaded into CLion, I ended up deciding to assemble this document to help me or others in the future, would the need eventually arise. Building the JDK - Building the JDK should be relatively painless, and when problems arise the tools are in generally very specific about what’s wrong.
